page.title: 03AGRICULTURE
page.content: AGRICULTURE.The area is predominantly agricultural.The main area around Erbistock is dairy farmed,that is permanent grass for the rearing of milk cattle.Some beef cattle and sheep are kept but no pigs.Beef cattle are grass fed, grazing outside for most of the year and fed on silage in the winter.Where there is an intensive bull beef system, the bulls are reared inside for 12 months.There is a small percentage of corn grown, consisting of winter barley, winter wheat and spring barley.A small acreage of potatoes is grown and sugar beet is a new crop in the area. Milk is sent to the Milk Marketing Board's Maelor Creamery.The beef cattle are killed in abbatoirs by the dead weight system.Sheep are sold in the Welshpool or local markets as are other stock,at Wrexham and Oswestry.
